bug.author: erip
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Loading a pretrained model currently fails because quantization_utils is imported which triggers the import of a non-module. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior (always include the command you ran):
Install fairseq Try to load a pretrained model.
<denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
A simpler reproducer is below: <denchmark-code>$ python -c "from fairseq.modules.quantization import pq, quantization_options, scalar" Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 1, in <module> ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'fairseq.modules.quantization' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
This should ... work. üòÑ <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): master PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0) 1.5.0 OS (e.g., Linux): OS X How you installed fairseq (pip, source): source Build command you used (if compiling from source): CFLAGS='-stdlib=libc++' pip install git+https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq.git Python version: 3.6.10 CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A GPU models and configuration: N/A Any other relevant information: N/A

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/myleott>@myleott</denchmark-link> I've got a PR open - looks like the test failures are unrelated...
